comments.commentBody: The US hasn't had any real moral authority for.... God who knows...decdes and decades.

So, Tuesday night the so-called President was Presidential because he could follow a TelePrompTer and didn't eat kittens from the well of the House.  Today, the real Trump returns with more nonsense. His life must be especially tortuous early in the mornings, when he's stewing in rage at all his demons.  It's frightening how this man's mind must work.  I only wish the rest of us didn't have to care.  And it must be absolutely hellish to work in this White House and this administration.  If a FISA warrant was issued, then a federal judge believed there was enough evidence that Trump was treasonous and a danger to the country.  If not, then this so-called President, with his pathetic rants, is slipping further and further into a dark and ugly place of his own creation.  Either way, God save the United States.

It's just the old Trump play book. Whenever there's something embarrassing or scandalous to his "administration," he says something wacky in a desperate attempt to divert attention.

With the news about Sessions and Kushner having contacts with the Russians, and with Pence's embarrassing Emailgate, Trump is foaming at the mouth to distract the media and the public.

I urge you: Don't fall for it. Keep your eyes on the Russian connection.
Is this the same guy who claimed that Barak Obama wasn't a US citizen? - then it must be a credible accusation.

He's paranoid...and he should be....because all Russian roads will lead to the Donald....he has attempted throughout to dust his tracks...but the posse is hot on the trail.....I don't understand why pundits and Congressmen repeatedly state he is the duly elected President...sure-- we all know he didn't win the popular vote...but if the Electors knew what we see unfolding....doubtful we would have had the same result....we will see if he can avoid impeachment for high treason....hope you haven't sold the Trump jet...you may need it again in the not too distant future...this guy can't stop shooting himself in the foot.

Trump's late-night accusations against Obama have ZERO supporting evidence.  Yet ABC-TV's "World News Tonight" gave the story top billing!  Is it any wonder that the American public have a low opinion of US journalism?
It is the job of journalism to report obvious lies, not ignore them!
Well, when the President of the  USA makes such an outrageous claim and malignes his predecessor with no proof, why would it NOT  be a top news story? Time for you to begin thinking critically.
He does have unseemly connections to the Russians, Rich. You will see.

Trump can't let go of the Apprentice.

Why can't he just go back to doing that? I'd gladly watch again. I was a big fan and watched many of the seasons until it became Celebrity Apprentice.

I don't like the spinoff- Presidential Apprentice- and I hope it gets cancelled soon.

Walling off the U.S. from the rest of the world did not work in the early 20th century. It has even less chance of working now.

In the 1930s you had to be wealthy to take a cruise, it took as much as three weeks to get to Europe. Diplomacy between countries took months of negotiations, while messages were sent by code back and forth.

Trade was by ship, each country produced most of their goods based on supply and demand. There were imports of course but industrial goods were mostly home made. Today we get steel from Korea, cotton from Egypt, cars from Germany, and so on. People can hop on a plane and be in another country in hours. Even Asia is just a short hop away. Boeing buys parts from China, the 767 has about half its parts built in France, Germany, and England.

People throughout the the world looked at the U.S. as an example of what industrialization and innovation can do. Many came to work here, they were needed in the mill, mines, on the railroads. They learned a lot about how to prosper and grow also. They also learned to compete, make goods that sold here and were priced right. We hear a lot of crowing about Capitalism, now that the rest of the world has caught up, those same braggarts want to get out of it. They have found a willing audience among those who were unable to adjust and keep up. Those who think they can just tell other countries what to do, who believe the U.S. is still better than everyone else. They are being proven wrong quickly.

We are no longer the world power those little minded people who listen to Rush and Fox want to believe. We can not just go around telling others how they have to behave, they also have economic power.

Their political systems are not exactly like our, but theirs works for them. I just took a trip to Spain, a country that had a bad recessions also, and sill has high unemployment, along with Catalonia where many want independence. But the trains were just great, it took three hours to go from Madrid to Valencia, about the same distance as from Sacramento to LA, comfortable quiet, table fro laptop, power outlet for electronics. Here in California Elaine Chow has pulled funds from electrification of Caltrain. Electric engines are much less expensive to repair, do not need refueling with oil, the motors can be changed out in hours, they do not pollute the cities they go through.

This administration is the most regressive in U.S. history, staffed by a cadre of self serving very wealthy people. Those of you who wrote about the supposed corruption of Clinton, can't seem to say a word about it.

As for all those good old Americans who support Trump, they have about as much economic knowledge as Daffy Duck.

Spain's economic power is emasculated by having 17 different regional governments all pulling in different directions. It's a total disaster with all the infighting and corruption. Some of the trains are good but a lot of public money has been wasted on vanity projects. They built a major high speed train station in a village with 26 inhabitants, all because it was a government minister's home town and that's just one example.

Oy, the media is trying to rehabilitate W in the wake of Trump.

He's definitely preferable to Donald but...

Let's not forget Iraq.

There is one person who can do everything, help everyone, make America great again, and that person is everyone who lives and works here whether immigrant or born in America.

When I look at the world economy I see a global economy with products made in China, Vietnam, South Korea and many other places. The world is a far different place than Mr Trump imagines but then understanding that is apparently not something he can grasp. This man will be exposed as the fraud he really is, sooner or later. Preferably sooner.
His supporters don't grasp it either, and that's the far larger problem.

"This man will be exposed as the fraud he really is, sooner or later."

He has repeatedly been exposed as a fraud, and events every day prove it again and again, though this seems to make no impression so far on Trump's followers.

Mitt Romney's denunciation was exactly right a year ago:

"Donald Trump is a phony, a fraud. His promises are as worthless as a degree from Trump University. He’s playing the American public for suckers: He gets a free ride to the White House and all we get is a lousy hat."

If it were really about preventing abortion, pro-lifers would be on every corner passing out birth control. We know that when women have information and access to contraception, abortion rates decrease, as they did after the ACA passed. But what they really want is to control women's sexuality. Planned Parenthood actually reduces the need for abortions by giving low-income women access to contraception. Defund PP and there will be more abortions.

It is staggering how hypocritical and sanctimonious so-called Christians are about life and poverty and death. Jesus would not support blaming victims, or suggesting that sperm's rights are more important that the choice and life of a woman with a life ahead of her.

Do not be the one to cast the first stone.

Meanwhile, health care is about to be changed from Obamacare to Wedontcare, aka Death Panels for those who can't afford care.

If you don't want too many poor people "preying" on your conscience, how about giving them the respect you demand yourself, the freedom from intrusive government and the ability to make choices about their lives.

For a laugh, check out Monty Python's "every sperm is sacred":
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUspLVStPbk
Thanks Susan!  I needed this.

It's very simple.  If President Obama's people wired Trump Towers illegally, just produce the proof.  What type of wire tap was it, where was it planted, can it be determined how long it was planted there--something that substantiate the claim.  If it there is/was a wiretap and it's not illegal than it was ordered by a Federal judge who deemed that there was enough evidence of wrong doings to order it. If that be the case it means that there is a paper trail that shows a Federal Judge had enough documentation that illegal activities were occurring at Trump Towers.  Not good for The Con.

Had enough!

I want to hear Donald Trump apologize to President Obama.
Right after he apologizes for his birther claims.

And that's so sad. Maybe not so much for us, but for our kids and grandkids, and beyond. Will we just be left with hate, a contaminated environment, no public education, health care, no news media, etc.? I mean, what's up?

Yet another successful distraction.  The news was focusing on Sessions and the Trump administration's Russia contacts.  Now all the headlines are about this nonsense.  Who cares if it's proven false--mission accomplished from Trump's perspective.
Don't think anyone's really forgotten about Russiagate. We can do more than one thing at a time!
the FISA court filing should be enough proof
Tell your victor, Trump, to stop tweeting lies.

*Why not hearts? You prefer one of the other suits?

*Re: Seaman's chapel
https://www.nps.gov/nebe/planyourvisit/bethel.htm

*Re: Capri
http://www.1001cocktails.com/recipes/mixed-drinks/101610/cocktail-capri....
More from the campaign playbook. Deflect any bad stories, ie. 6 members of his team tied to Russia, by saying something even more outrageous.
You're claims are exaggerated and suppositions. To quote someone you once voted for, "Get back in your cage."
Sorry, no.
That's quite an "if"!

This has got to stop! This is merely the birther claim re-packaged.

And if the FBI found out anything about the Trump campaign and its relationship with the Russians, it is because it was monitoring the RUSSIANS, not Trump. Comey's gift keeps on giving, but, hey, maybe he can redeem himself if he maintains the independence of the Bureau without falling into J. Edgar Hoover's dark practices.
Does that mean Orly will be raising her ugly  head soon?
